snippet: A disclosure made by a former gang member meeting with prosecutors may lead to the release of five people serving long prison terms in the killing of a livery cabdriver in the Bronx.
abstract: Disclosure in 2003 by Gilbert Vega, former member of drug gang who had been regularly cooperating with prosecutors on a separate case, may lead to the release of five people serving long prison terms; Vega revealed that he and another man robbed and fatally shot a livery cabdriver in the Bronx in 1995 for which the five had been wrongfully convicted; revelation offers a rare look at how information from cooperating witnesses can reverberate far beyond the case in which the witness is charged.
lead_paragraph: A disclosure made by a former gang member meeting with prosecutors may lead to the release of five people serving long prison terms in the killing of a livery cabdriver in the Bronx.

headline.seo: Break in Cabby’s Killing Shows Impact of Cooperating Witnesses
headline.main: Break in ’95 Murder Case Shows Reverberations of Using a Cooperating Witness
headline.print_headline: Break in ’95 Murder Case Shows Reverberations of Using a Cooperating Witness
